etymology.description: 舌(舌) (shé, 'tongue') with added horizontal stroke -> indicates movement of the tongue -> modern form with additional stroke -> speech
etymology.interpretation: The character 言(yán, 'words') visually represents the concept of speech by depicting the movement of the tongue, suggesting the act of speaking.

examples.chinese: 他用寥寥几言(他用寥寥幾言)，击中了问题的要害(擊中了問題的要害)。
examples.pinyin: tā yòng liáo liáo jǐ yán jī zhòng le wèn tí de yào hài
examples.english: He hit the core of the issue with only a few words.
When he speaks, his words are always followed by actions.

examples.chinese: 他说话时总是考虑周到(他說話時總是考慮周到)，每一句言辞都充满智慧(每一句言辭都充滿智慧)。
examples.pinyin: tā shuō huà shí zǒng shì kǎo lǜ zhōu dào, měi yī jù yán cí dōu chōng mǎn zhì huì
examples.english: When he speaks, he always considers things carefully; every word he utters is full of wisdom.
